Uses of Package
org.universAAL.lddi.abstraction

  • Packages that use org.universAAL.lddi.abstraction 
    Package Description
    org.universAAL.lddi.abstraction
    This package assumes that there are external (meaning not readily connected to universAAL) networking-enabled HW/SW components to which we may need access in a universAAL network.
    org.universAAL.lddi.abstraction.config.data  
    org.universAAL.lddi.abstraction.config.protocol  
    org.universAAL.lddi.abstraction.config.tool  
    org.universAAL.lddi.abstraction.simulation  
  • Classes in org.universAAL.lddi.abstraction used by org.universAAL.lddi.abstraction 
    Class and Description
    CommunicationGateway
    A gateway providing a bridge to a network of external components making it for component integrators possible to gain access to related external datapoints.
    ExternalComponent
    An external component is a hard- or software component that is outside the universAAL network and can be reached via a gateway.
    ExternalComponentDiscoverer 
    ExternalDatapoint
    An ExternalDatapoint is a readable and / or writable datapoint outside the universAAL network.
  • Classes in org.universAAL.lddi.abstraction used by org.universAAL.lddi.abstraction.config.data 
    Class and Description
    CommunicationGateway
    A gateway providing a bridge to a network of external components making it for component integrators possible to gain access to related external datapoints.
    ExternalComponent
    An external component is a hard- or software component that is outside the universAAL network and can be reached via a gateway.
    ExternalComponentDiscoverer 
    ExternalDatapoint
    An ExternalDatapoint is a readable and / or writable datapoint outside the universAAL network.
  • Classes in org.universAAL.lddi.abstraction used by org.universAAL.lddi.abstraction.config.protocol 
    Class and Description
